abstracts.cdata!:
The project is rated unsatisfactory, and
            sustainability is unlikely. The establishment of an
            incentive framework, through the provision of security
            land-ownership, and strengthening of agricultural support
            services, was not, however, enough to improve the pace, and
            diversity of agricultural production, and, the weak project
            design lead to significant risks, and constraints, difficult
            to overcome. The lessons suggest that: 1) the constraints
            encountered during preparation, such as structural weakness
            of the sugar industry, should have been subject to rigorous
            analysis, and, in the absence of an adequate project design
            to sustain them, consideration of a different project would
            have been appropriate; 2) despite the fact that this project
            was designed prior to the full acknowledgement of the
            importance of beneficiary consultation, a sound assessment
            of social, and political environments, conducted during
            preparation, would have helped in a number of issues,
            including the need to evaluate factors, such as other
            sectors, possibly influencing the project; 3) in line with
            the previous comment, the requirement for
            monitoring/evaluation, mid-term reviews, and performance
            indicators, confirms that the approach the Bank now attaches
            to these activities, is needed for reviewing implementation
            progress; and, 4) enforcement of loan covenants should be
            linked to different aspects of the loan portfolio, or to
            other pipeline projects.
